greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Figurate numbers based on the 8-dimensional regular convex polytope called the 8-dimensional cross-polytope, or 8-dimensional hyperoctahedron, which is represented by the Schlaefli symbol {3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 4}. It is the dual of the 8-dimensional hypercube.
reference: H. S. M. Coxeter, Regular Polytopes, New York: Dover, 1973.
J. V. Post, "4-Dimensional Jonathan numbers: polytope numbers and Centered polytope numbers of Higher Than 3 Dimensions", Draft 1.5 of 9 a.m., 12 March 2004, circulated by e-mail.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
M. Janjic and B. Petkovic, A Counting Function, arXiv 1301.4550 [math.CO], 2013.
M. Janjic, B. Petkovic, A Counting Function Generalizing Binomial Coefficients and Some Other Classes of Integers, J. Int. Seq. 17 (2014) # 14.3.5
Hyun Kwang Kim, On Regular Polytope Numbers, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 131 (2003), 65-75.
J. V. Post, Table of polytope numbers, Sorted, Through 1,000,000.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (9,-36,84,-126,126,-84,36,-9,1).
formula: a(n) = 16*a(n-1)/(n-1) + a(n-2) for n > 1. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Jun 06 2018
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Nov 16 2004
